newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso ends six centavos weaker, off lows.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso ends six centavos weaker, off lows.

text.p: Mexico's benchmark 48-hour peso clawed back some ground lost to the dollar in late trade, but still closed considerably weaker on Monday after a session marked by jitters and speculation.

"The peso weakened very quickly. Movements were too drastic and the peso reached a level where (the market) feared Banco de Mexico might intervene, which made dealers dump surplus (dollar) positions towards the close," a trader said.
The 24-hour and 48-hour peso both closed six centavos weaker at 7.7250/7.7350 and 7.7300/7.7400 per dollar, respectively. There were no same-day trades. (c) Reuters Limited 1996
